title: Go Core 100
description: A guided set of 100 Go katas grouped into category tracks for structured progression.

categories.title: Foundations
categories.description: Core syntax, control flow, and deterministic behavior.
categories.learning_goal: Convert plain-language requirements into clear, testable Go functions.

categories.title: Data, Text, and Formatting
categories.description: Parsing, transformation, data structures, and small algorithmic tasks.
categories.learning_goal: Build confidence with strict input contracts, transformations, and edge-case correctness.

categories.title: I/O and Service Boundaries
categories.description: HTTP, files, process boundaries, and composable service behavior.
categories.learning_goal: Treat external boundaries as contracts and return predictable behavior under failure.

categories.title: Concurrency and Reliability
categories.description: Concurrent coordination, cancellation, resilience patterns, and time-sensitive workflows.
categories.learning_goal: Design safe lifecycle ownership and resilient runtime behavior under load.

categories.title: Tooling, Security, and Advanced Design
categories.description: CLI tools, cryptography, testing discipline, generics, reflection, and design patterns.
categories.learning_goal: Apply production-grade quality standards to interfaces, correctness, and maintainability.
